column4: hey i just installed ubuntu 6.06lts, i know if i change my IP which is currently getting it's net info via DHCP it will break sudo. how should i go about preventing breaking sudo when i want to change my IP?
so how can i switch ips without breaking SUDO
it breaks sudo? what?
maybe you typoed something?  I've changed IP's a lot from static to dhcp, etc and never broken sudo.
if you can stick around in 10 minutes i'll change it and reboot it and show you what i mean
yeah grab some error messages and stuffs
does an apt-get upgrade grab the latest kernel too ?
what does uname -a give you?  Are you on the latest kernel?  Mine usually updates automatically for me when needed through the update manager
it says, Linux ubuntu 2.6.15-26-server #1 SMP Thu Aug 3 04:09:15 UTC 2006 i686 GNU/Linux
is this the most up2date version?
no, at least, I'm on 2.6.22-14
, so how do i go about updating the kernel? when i do apt-get upgrade it says it isn't doing the pkg linux-image-server
oh, just do like dist-upgrade and I think that will then do it for you.
instead of just upgrade
what is the diff between dist-upgrade and upgrade?
check the man page for more details, but in short  in addition to performing the function of upgrade, also intelligently handles changing dependencies with new versions of packages
any huge security issue in the kernel between these 2 ersion?s
ummm nothing major that I"ve ever seen.  I'm sure there are minor fixes here and there, but I haven't heard of a major kernel issue that has affected a normal user in a while actually.  I don't know.
